meanings.definition: The state or quality of being old.
meanings.sent1: The oldnesses of the house were evident in its creaky floors.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the oldnesses of the book by its yellowed pages.
meanings.sent3: The oldnesses of the clock made it seem like it had seen centuries pass by.
meanings.sent4: The oldnesses of the traditions were comforting in their familiarity.
meanings.sent5: The oldnesses of the photograph captured a bygone era perfectly.

meanings.definition: The condition of being advanced in age.
meanings.sent1: His oldnesses were apparent in the way he moved slowly.
meanings.sent2: The cat showed its oldnesses by napping most of the day.
meanings.sent3: The oldnesses of the tree made it wise in the eyes of the forest animals.
meanings.sent4: Her oldnesses were a testament to a life well-lived.
meanings.sent5: The oldnesses of the dog were evident in its gray muzzle.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being ancient or outdated.
meanings.sent1: The oldnesses of the technology were evident in its bulky design.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer avoided oldnesses in her new collection.
meanings.sent3: The oldnesses of the music player made it a relic of the past.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were filled with oldnesses that needed a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent5: The oldnesses of the language used in the play added a touch of nostalgia.
